Today Headmaster Chaney sent out an update to the Spartan community regarding some exciting updates to the Capital Campaign.

We have made great strides in our campaign thus far, raising $1m in our initial launch ‚Äì the most successful capital campaign of any Great Hearts school. Due to the demand for enrollment at our schools, we are able to reduce the original goal of 5.7 million. We now need to raise 1.5 million to complete our campus home! This new goal of 1.5 million by May 2020 will give us an AIA regulation sports field with synthetic turf for football and soccer, bleacher seating for 300, locker rooms, restrooms, and concession area. We are almost there! Construction can begin as soon as this summer. Please join us by making your gift to our Better Together Campaign today for our students, for our community, and for generations to come!

post_text: Congratulations to SPA junior Adway Gopakumar for his leadership in promoting "Liberation Through Education", a service and fundraising project he is spearheading as a member of the SPA Rotary Interact Club. Adway presented his vision for local high school Rotary clubs to partner to be a driving force in liberating under-privileged schools in India at a recent Rotary Club of Scottsdale luncheon. Members of the Rotary Club were so touched by Adway's presentation that they made a significant financial contribution to the cause. The SPA club will be hosting a Dodgeball Tournament on Friday, April 13th to raise more money to help reach the goal of providing backpacks, umbrellas, uniforms, stationery items and toys as well as providing laptops and a printer for the teachers. Pictured (L to R) are Rotarians Max Rumbaugh and Charlie Kester: Adway Gopakumar (SPA Interact Club Vice President), Mrs. Sterner (SPA Interact Club Sponsor) and David Bertelli (SPA Interact Club Advisor)
